intro: Dipteracanthus australasicus subsp. glabratus, commonly known as the smooth-flowered dipteracanthus, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers with four petals. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered vulnerable to environmental changes and habitat loss.
